english.BANANA: A long, curved fruit with a yellow skin and soft, sweet, white flesh inside. (dictionary.cambridge.org)

english.PHEASANT: A large bird with a rounded body and long tail, that spends a lot of time on the ground and is often shot for sport and food, or the meat of this bird. (dictionary.cambridge.org)

english.COMPUTER: An electronic machine that is used for storing, organizing, and finding words, numbers, and pictures, for doing calculations, and for controlling other machines. (dictionary.cambridge.org)

english.TABLE: A flat surface, usually supported by four legs, used for putting things on. (dictionary.cambridge.org)

english.SYRINGE: A hollow, cylinder-shaped piece of equipment used for sucking liquid out of something or pushing liquid into something, especially one with a needle that can be put under the skin and used to inject drugs, remove small amounts of blood, etc. (dictionary.cambridge.org)

english.MICROPHONE: A piece of equipment that you speak into to make your voice louder, or to record your voice or other sounds. (dictionary.cambridge.org)

english.THUNDER: The sudden loud noise that comes from the sky especially during a storm. (dictionary.cambridge.org)

english.OAK: A large tree that is common in northern parts of the world, or the hard wood of this tree. (dictionary.cambridge.org)

english.GARDEN: A piece of land, usually in a yard next to a house, where you grow flowers and vegetables. (dictionary.cambridge.org)

english.VENTILATOR: An opening or a device that allows fresh air to come into a closed space. (dictionary.cambridge.org)

english.MEDICINE: Treatment for illness or injury, or the study of this. (dictionary.cambridge.org)

english.CHAIR: A seat for one person that has a back, usually four legs, and sometimes two arms. (dictionary.cambridge.org)
